tasks.task: Plant and harvest radishes for profit.
subtasks: Choose a suitable location with well-drained soil.
Plant radish seeds at an appropriate depth and spacing.
Water regularly to maintain optimal moisture levels.
Monitor for pests and apply organic treatments if necessary.
Harvest radishes within 3-4 weeks of planting.

tasks.task: Grow and sell lettuce for profit.
subtasks: Find a sunny spot in the garden for lettuce cultivation.
Prepare the soil with rich compost and ensure consistent moisture.
Sow lettuce seeds in rows, maintaining proper spacing.
Use the cut-and-come-again method for continuous harvesting.
Water lettuce regularly, especially during dry periods.
Apply organic pest control measures as needed.
Harvest lettuce heads or cut outer leaves as needed.

tasks.task: Cultivate herbs (e.g., basil, mint, cilantro) for sale.
subtasks: Select herb varieties suitable for local climate and soil.
Plant herbs in well-draining soil, either in garden beds or containers.
Water herbs regularly, ensuring consistent moisture.
Provide adequate sunlight or use grow lights for indoor herbs.
Harvest herbs by cutting stems above the leaves, leaving growth points intact.
Dry or refrigerate harvested herbs for later sale.

tasks.task: Produce green beans for market or canning.
subtasks: Choose green bean varieties appropriate for your growing zone.
Plant beans after the last frost date, in warm soil.
Provide support structures (e.g., trellises) for climbing plants.
Water plants regularly, keeping soil consistently moist.
Fertilize with balanced fertilizer during the growing season.
Harvest beans when pods are firm and colorful, usually 50-60 days after planting.
Prepare beans for immediate sale or canning as needed.

tasks.task: Farm zucchini for local markets or restaurant supply.
subtasks: Sow zucchini seeds in warm soil after last frost.
Provide plenty of space for plants to spread (each plant needs about 5-6 feet).
Regularly mulch to retain soil moisture and suppress weeds.
Monitor for blossom end rot and other disease issues.
Harvest zucchini when they are 6-8 inches long and tender.
Sell zucchini at farmer’s markets or directly to restaurants.
Select high-yielding, disease-resistant potato varieties.
Plant potatoes after the last frost, in loose, well-drained soil.
Hilled up soil around growing plants to protect tubers from greening.
Water potatoes during dry spells, keeping soil moist but not waterlogged.
Weed regularly to prevent competition for nutrients.
Harvest potatoes when foliage turns yellow (about 70-120 days after planting).
Cure potatoes before storage to improve shelf life.

tasks.task: Cultivate sunflowers for seed, oil, or floral markets.
subtasks: Plant sunflower seeds in full sun, after the last frost.
Provide sufficient space (1-2 feet apart) between plants.
Water sunflowers regularly during the growing season.
Support tall varieties with stakes if needed.
Collect seeds when capitula (flower heads) turn brown.
Process seeds for sale or oil extraction.
